title: Lebanese pound
summary: The Lebanese pound (Arabic: ليرة لبنانية‎ līra Libnāniyya; French: livre libanaise; sign: LL in Latin, ل.ل.‎ in Arabic, ISO 4217: LBP) is the currency of Lebanon. It was formerly divided into 100 piastres (or qirsh) but because of high inflation during the Lebanese Civil War (1975–1990) the use of  subdivisions was discontinued.
